interface.name: jsx3.gui.Form
interface.text: Mixin interface. Contains methods and constants encapsulating the functionality of an HTML form control.

field.name: OPTIONAL
field.text: Value for the required field indicating that the form field is optional.

field.name: REQUIRED
field.text: Value for the required field indicating that the form field is required.

field.name: STATEDISABLED
field.text: Value for the enabled field indicating that the form field is disabled.

field.name: STATEENABLED
field.text: Value for the enabled field indicating that the form field is enabled.

field.name: STATEINVALID
field.text: Value for the validation state field indicating that the value of the form field is invalid.

field.name: STATEVALID
field.text: Value for the validation state field indicating that the value of the form field is valid.

method.name: doKeyBinding

param.name: fctCallback
param.text: JavaScript function to execute when the given sequence is keyed by the user.

param.name: strKeys
param.text: a plus-delimited ('+') key sequence such as ctrl+s or ctrl+shift+alt+h or shift+a, etc. Any combination of shift, ctrl, and alt are supported, including none. Also supported as the final token are enter, esc, tab, del, and space. To specify the final token as a key code, the last token can be the key code contained in brackets, [13].

return.text: the registered hot key or null if strKeys is an invalid key combination.

method.text:
Binds the given key sequence to a callback function. Any object that has a key binding (specified with setKeyBinding()) will call this method when painted to register the key sequence with an appropriate ancestor of this form control. Any key down event that bubbles up to the ancestor without being intercepted and matches the given key sequence will invoke the given callback function.
As of 3.2: The hot key will be registered with the first ancestor found that is either a jsx3.gui.Window, a jsx3.gui.Dialog, or the root block of a jsx3.app.Server.

method.name: doReset
method.text: Resets the validation state of this control.

method.name: doValidate
method.text: Abstract method that must be implemented by any class that implements the Form interface.

method.name: getDisabledBackgroundColor
method.text: Returns the background color of this control when it is disabled.

method.name: getDisabledColor
method.text: Returns the font color to use when this control is disabled.

method.name: getEnabled
method.text: Returns the state for the form field control. If no enabled state is set, this method returns STATEENABLED.

method.name: getKeyBinding

return.text: plus-delimited (e.g.,'+') key sequence such as ctrl+s or ctrl+shift+alt+h or shift+a, etc

method.text: Returns the key binding that when keyed will fire the execute event for this control.

method.name: getRequired
method.text: Returns whether or not this control is required. If the required property has never been set, this method returns OPTIONAL.

method.name: getValidationState
method.text: Returns the validation state of this control. If the validationState property has never been set, this method returns STATEVALID.

method.name: getValue
method.text: Returns the value of this control.

method.name: setDisabledBackgroundColor
method.text: Sets the background color of this form control when it is disabled.

method.name: setDisabledColor
method.text: Sets the font color to use when this control is disabled.

method.name: setEnabled

param.name: bRepaint
param.text: if true this control is immediately repainted to reflect the new setting.

method.text: Sets whether this control is enabled. Disabled controls do not respond to user interaction.

method.name: setKeyBinding

param.name: strSequence
param.text: plus-delimited (e.g.,'+') key sequence such as ctrl+s or ctrl+shift+alt+h or shift+a, etc

method.text: Sets the key binding that when keyed will fire the bound execute (jsx3.gui.Interactive.EXECUTE) event for this control.

method.name: setRequired
method.text: Sets whether or not this control is required.

method.name: setValidationState
method.text: Sets the validation state of this control. The validation state of a control is not serialized.

method.name: setValue
method.text: Sets the value of this control.

method.name: getVersion
method.text: Returns the release/build for the class (i.e., "2.2.00")

method.name: reset

param.name: objJSXContainer
param.text: JSX GUI object containing all form fields that need to be reset (the 'reset' process will start with this item and be applied to all descendants, not just direct children)

method.text: Traverses the DOM branch starting at objJSXContainer and calls doReset() on all nodes of type jsx3.gui.Form.

method.name: validate

param.name: objJSXContainer
param.text: JSX GUI object containing all form fields that need to be validated (recursive validation will start with this item and be applied to all descendants, not just direct children)

param.name: objHandler
param.text: a JavaScript function (as object). This function will be passed two parameters: the object reference to the JSX Form object (textbox, selectbox, checkbox, etc) being validated as well as a constant denoting whether or not it validated (0 or 1)—1 meaning true

method.text: Traverses the DOM branch starting at objJSXContainer and calls doValidate() on all nodes of type jsx3.gui.Form. A custom function handler, objHandler, can be passed that will be called once for each encountered form control.
